case_title: ABDUL REHMAN vs PROVINCIAL TRANSPORT AUTHORITY, BALOCHISTAN through Chairman and 3 others
respondant: Provincial Transport Authority, Balochistan through Chairman

defense: Mr. Naeem Akhtar Afghan (Counsel for Petitioner)
Syed Ayaz Zahoor (Counsel for Respondent No. 4)

complaint_summary: Petitioner challenged the cancellation of his route permit for plying buses from Pishin to Rod Mullazia via Khanozai, which was set aside by the appellate authority citing non-classification of the route under Rule-57-A of Motor Vehicle Rules, 1969.
investigation_summary: Counter affidavits filed by respondents alleged that the petitioner converted his bus into a truck and did not approach the court with clean hands. A report confirmed the conversion of the bus into a truck.
judgment_summary: The court declared the appellate authority's order cancelling the route permit as unlawful, restored the permit, and directed the competent authority to classify the route. It held that respondent No. 4 lacked locus standi to challenge the permit.
Decision_or_verdict: Petition disposed of; route permit restored.
legal_arguments: Rule-57-A of Motor Vehicle Rules, 1969 does not provide penal consequences for unclassified routes.
Respondent No. 4 lacked locus standi as he was not a competitor for the same route.
Article 18 of the Constitution protects the right to lawful business and trade.
statutes: Article 18 of the Constitution of Islamic Republic of Pakistan, 1973
sections: Rules 57-A and 57-B of Motor Vehicle Rules, 1969

witness_statement.Naib Tehsildar, Pishin: Reported that the bus bearing registration No. BMA-402 was converted into truck bearing registration No. TKE-241.

key_issues: Validity of route permit under Rule-57-A of Motor Vehicle Rules, 1969
Impact of vehicle conversion on route permit rights

maxims.Article 18: Right to lawful business and trade.

legal_terms.Route Classification: Categorization of routes based on traffic density and road conditions under Rule-57-A.
legal_terms.Locus Standi: Legal standing to bring a case or challenge a decision.

words_and_phrases.Highway: Physical track along which a vehicle runs.
words_and_phrases.Route: Abstract line of travel between two termini.

summary_vector_notes: Petitioner Abdul Rehman challenged the cancellation of his route permit for buses on the grounds of non-classification under Rule-57-A of Motor Vehicle Rules, 1969. The court restored the permit, holding that respondent No. 4 lacked locus standi and that the appellate authority's decision was unlawful.
